thread.title: Tourism Trade Fair In Paris Gives Seychelles Minister St.Ange An Opportunity To Increase Visibility Of His Islands As He Ensures That The Seychelles Remains Relevant
thread.title_full: Tourism Trade Fair In Paris Gives Seychelles Minister St.Ange An Opportunity To Increase Visibility Of His Islands As He Ensures That The Seychelles Remains Relevant

author: Thidawan Tunya
title: Tourism Trade Fair In Paris Gives Seychelles Minister St.Ange An Opportunity To Increase Visibility Of His Islands As He Ensures That The Seychelles Remains Relevant
text:
Email 
The Top Resa Tourism Trade Fair of France was an opportunity for Alain St.Ange, the Seychelles Minister responsibility for Tourism and Culture to meet the press in what he describes as and ‘Island Style Dialogue with the Press”. 
In a series of extensive press interviews the Seychelles Minister gave an expose of tourism in the Seychelles. The state of affairs with tourism arrival figures now on a year to date basis touching an increase of 20% . Also points discussed were the existing public – private sector partnership that exists in tourism, the recent announced moratorium in construction of large hotels, the carrying capacity of the islands being carried out, the recently launched recognition park for tourism private sector personalities, among others. 
Together with his Vanilla islands Colleagues the Seychelles Minister also met press on regional cooperation and the successes of the Vanilla islands grouping today recording an marked increase into or three islands combinations. 
Apart from television and radio interviews , Minister St.Ange also met with Le Monde Journalist, and the reporter for ETATS, Le Magazine de L’Afrique among many others. The Seychelles Tourism and Culture Minister said that through Press Interviews he is able to increase the visibility Seychelles gets in the island’s tourism target markets to ensure Seychelles remains always relevant as a holiday destination.
